page.title: 09POLLUTION/CONSERVATION
page.content: In our area some species of wildlife are in danger because of pollution and farming methods. There is hardly a{corncrake}to be heard. They have been killed by combines and forage harvesters. Many {birds of prey}have been poisoned through eating food that is polluted by chemicals. People shoot birds for fun, never thinking they are wiping them out. {Hedgehogs}and{stoats}are being killed by road traffic as well as having their hedges dug away by farmers who are making fields larger.Some{insects} are also becoming scarce through eating leaves sprayed with chemicals. In 1985, a new Act of Parliament has been passed to protect wildlife in areas like ours.
